/wiki/Erika_Olivera: Érika Alejandra Olivera de la Fuente ( born 4 January 1976 in Quinta Normal ) is a female marathon runner from Chile and deputy for the National Renewal party . She has competed at five Olympic Games , the most Olympic appearances ever by a female marathon runner .
/wiki/Athletics_at_the_1999_Pan_American: The athletics competition at the 1999 Pan American Games was held at University Stadium in Winnipeg , Manitoba , Canada . Two new events were introduced for women : pole vault and hammer throw . In addition the 20 km road walk replaced the 10,000 m track walk .
The women 's marathon event at the 1999 Pan American Games was held on July 25 .
/wiki/Denisse_Van_Lamoen: Denisse Astrid van Lamoen ( born 12 September 1979 ) is a Chilean archer . In 2000 , she became the first Chilean archer to compete at the Summer Olympics , but after failing a drug test in 2002 she left archery to study law . She later returned to the sport . In 2011 , she was voted Chile 's Athlete of the Year after winning at the 2011 World Archery Championships . She was selected to be Chile 's flag-bearer at the 2012 Summer Olympics . She is of Dutch descent .
/wiki/Archery_at_the_1999_Pan_American_G: Archery at the 1999 Pan American Games was held from 04 to 8 August 1999 . The events took place at a temporary site at Assiniboine Park in Winnipeg , Manitoba , Canada . Just like in the Olympics , the archery competition will be held using the recurve bow .
/wiki/Paris_Inostroza: Paris Inostroza ( born 22 September 1972 ) is a Chilean fencer . He competed in the individual épée events at the 1996 , 2004 , 2008 , and 2012 Summer Olympics .
/wiki/B\u00e1rbara_Castro: Bárbara Castro ( born 8 September 1975 ) is a Chilean former professional tennis player .
/wiki/Paula_Cabezas: Paula Andrea Cabezas ( born 21 August 1972 ) is a Chilean former professional tennis player .
/wiki/Tennis_at_the_1999_Pan_American_Ga: The tennis competition at the 1999 Pan American Games was held from July 29 to August 5 , 1999 , at the Winnipeg Lawn Tennis Club in Winnipeg , Manitoba , Canada . Men 's and women 's singles and doubles events were held .
Women 's doubles at the 1999 Pan American Games was won by Joana Cortez and Vanessa Menga of Brazil .
/wiki/Cristian_Escalante: Cristián Escalante ( born September 11 , 1976 in Santiago ) is a Chilean a weightlifter competing in the +105 kg category . Escalante has competed in three Pan American Games starting in 1999 . Escalante in 1996 became the first weightlifter to qualify for the Olympics from Chile . After placing silver at the 1999 and winning the silver medal at the 2003 Pan American Games , Escalante finally won a gold medal at the 2007 Pan American Games in Rio de Janeiro . In this process he broke the Pan American Games record in the overall competition by lifting a total of 401 kg . In September 2011 , Escalante was named the flag bearer for the Chilean team at the 2011 Pan American Games in Guadalajara , Mexico . Escalante was scheduled to compete in his fourth Pan American Games , however he did not carry the flag or compete after testing positive for steroids .
/wiki/Weightlifting_at_the_1999_Pan_Amer: This page shows the results of the Weightlifting Competition at the 1999 Pan American Games , held from July 23 to August 8 , 1999 , in Winnipeg , Manitoba , Canada . There were a total number of fifteen medal events , eight for men and seven for women .
/wiki/Sebastian_Keitel: Sebastián Keitel Bianchi ( born February 14 , 1973 , in Santiago ) is a Chilean ex-sprinter who competed mostly in the 200 metres . He was coached by renowned Chilean coach Pedro Soto Acuña .
/wiki/Athletics_at_the_1999_Pan_American: The men 's 200 metres event at the 1999 Pan American Games was held July 27-28 .
/wiki/Berta_Rodriguez: Berta Rodríguez ( born 24 June 1971 ) is a Chilean table tennis player . She competed for Chile at the 2012 Summer Olympics .
/wiki/Cycling_at_the_1999_Pan_American_G: The cycling competition at the 1999 Pan American Games was held in Winnipeg , Manitoba , Canada .
/wiki/Rowing_at_the_1999_Pan_American_Ga: Nine men 's and five women 's rowing events took place at the 1999 Pan American Games in Canada . The gold medals were won by rowers from the United States , Canada and Argentina .
/wiki/Miguel_Cerda: Miguel Cerda ( born 27 December 1969 in Valdivia ) is a Chilean rower .
/wiki/Christi\u00e1n_Yantani: Christián Yantani Garces ( born 8 August 1975 in Valdivia ) is a Chilean rower .
/wiki/F\u00e9lipe_Leal: Félipe Leal ( born 8 March 1982 ) is a Chilean rower . He competed in the men 's single sculls event at the 2000 Summer Olympics .
/wiki/Angela_Grisar: Angela Grisar ( born May 2 , 1973 ) is a Chilean racquetball player . She is the most accomplished South American woman 's racquetball player ever , winning numerous medals in international competitions as well as a women 's pro tournament .
/wiki/Racquetball_at_the_1999_Pan_Americ: This page shows the results of the Racquetball Competition for men and women at the 1999 Pan American Games , held from July 23 to August 8 , 1999 in Winnipeg , Manitoba , Canada .
